answers.answer: Hello,Information comes to part of brain from the vestibular system located in the inner ears which help keep the body upright and allow it to move in a coordinated fashion. Vertigo is caused due to dysfunction of the vestibular system. Ear causes are the commonest causes of vertigo. Benign paroxysmal vertigo, Meniere's disease, labyrinthitis, head trauma, neck injury, and migraine all can cause vertigo. Other possibility is that your symptoms could be due to Syncope, which is temporary loss of consciousness and posture, described as "fainting" or "passing out." Check with your doctor to rule out anemia and metabolic disorders like diabetes. If your dizziness feels like you are spinning or the room is spinning (and especially if associated with nausea or vomiting), this might be due to an inner ear problem. The condition needs proper evaluation. Keep me posted.Best luck and regards!

question: i got really dizzy in school it was vertigo but i put my head down when it happened so i couldn't see everything spinning but it felt like i was since then i have been off i have this constant 24/7 pressure on my eyes they feel strained out all the time constant sinus pressure i get headaches in the back of my head this fullness in the headed and i feel lightheaded this has been going on for 4 months straight i had a mri of the head and neck balance and hearing test i was seen by 2 ents and they coudnt find anything worng i had many blood test done and saw a neurologist and still nothing what could be causing this im taking nasal sprays because of the bad sinus pressure i saw a allergist and was allergic to dust mights could that be causing this
title: lightheaded all the time
